Package es.csic.iiia.bms.factors

Efficient implementations of some particular higher-order factors.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
CardinalityFactor.CardinalityFunction Interface of a cardinality function.
 

Class Summary
AbstractFactor<T> Skeletal implementation of a Max-Sum factor.
AbstractTwoSidedFactor<T> Abstract class for two-sided factors.
AllActiveIncentiveFactor<T> A factor that (de)incentivizes a group of variables (from being) to be all on.
AtMostOneFactor<T> Max-sum "at most one" factor.
CardinalityFactor<T> Cardinality factor.
CompositeIndependentFactor<T> Deprecated.  
ConditionedSelectorFactor<T> Max-sum conditioned selector factor.
EqualityFactor<T> Equality constraint, that tries to ensure that all variables have the same value.
ImplicationFactor<T> Max-sum "Implication" factor.
IndependentFactor<T> Factor that includes an independent cost/utility for each of the variables in its scope (its neighbors).
ProxyFactor<T> Skeletal implementation of a factor that relays (possibly modified) messages into/out of another wrapped factor.
SaturationFactor<T> Factor that selects the best active neighbor but doesn't constraint others.
SaturationKFactor<T> Factor that selects the best k active neighbor but doesn't constraint others.
SelectorFactor<T> Max-sum selector factor.
SingleWeightFactor<T> Factor that composes (sums) an independent cost/utility for each neighbor with some other inner (non-independent) factor.
StandardFactor<T> Implementation of a standard (binary) max-sum factor.
TwoSidedEqualityFactor<T> Max-sum "Two-sided equality" factor.
TwoSidedReserveFactor<T> Max-sum "Two-sided reserve" factor.
VariableFactor<T> Factor defined over a single variable (variable node in classical MaxSum).
WeightingFactor<T> Factor that composes (sums) an independent cost/utility for each neighbor with some other inner (non-independent) factor.
 

Package es.csic.iiia.bms.factors Description

Efficient implementations of some particular higher-order factors.
